meanings.definition: The rounded knob on the end of a bone, especially the humerus.
meanings.sent1: The capitellum of the humerus helps in forming the elbow joint.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed to the capitellum on the X-ray to explain the injury.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the capitellum bone toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, hitting my ears like a capitellum.
meanings.sent5: The shiny capitellum gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.

meanings.definition: A small capital or capital letter at the beginning of a paragraph or section.
meanings.sent1: The book started with a large capitellum at the beginning of each chapter.
meanings.sent2: In the document, the capitellum marked the start of a new section.
meanings.sent3: The teacher emphasized the importance of using a capitellum in the essay.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a capitellum, drawing attention to the key points.
meanings.sent5: The capitellum stood out boldly, inviting readers to delve into the text.
